contentrichtext.text: '''Nigel Edward Buxton''' (born 1924) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] travel writer and wine critic, also known for appearing as '''BaaadDad''' in the [[Channel 4]] comedy series ''[[The Adam and Joe Show]]'', which was written and presented by his son [[Adam Buxton]] along with Adam's friend [[Joe Cornish (entertainer)|Joe Cornish]].<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/media/2001/jan/24/tvandradio.television1 TV and Radio: The Adam and Joe show | Culture | The Guardian]</ref> The comedy behind the character of BaaadDad is the juxtaposition of the fact that he is clearly an [[elderly]] and [[upper middle class]] man with the topics that he discusses, which relate to [[youth culture]] - [[nightclub|clubbing]], [[recreational drug use|drug use]], and so on. In this character, he featured in the video for [[Frank Black]]'s single Dog Gone. Buxton has a Twitter account and tweets as @baaaddad and blogs at baaaddad.wordpress.com "Walking in Wine Country" was published by Weidenfeld and Nicholson in 1993 ==References== {{BLP sources|date=July 2010}} {{Reflist}} {{Adam and Joe}} {{Authority control|VIAF=31070483}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Buxton, Nigel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1924 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Buxton, Nigel}} [[Category:1924 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:British travel writers]] {{UK-actor-stub}}
